Package models

Class CivModel

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
models.CivModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class CivModel
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.io.Serializable
Holds game state data and provides utility methods to query or update it.
Author:
Connie Sun, Ryan Smith, Luke Hankins, Tim Gavlick
See Also:
Serialized Form

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    private class  CivModel.Node
    Node class for keeping a wrapped list of players

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    CivModel()
    CivModel is another constructor that will be called if the user wants to load a previous game state CivModel() unserializes a previously existing game state and sets appropriate attributes of all relevant classes.
    CivModel​(int playerCount, int map, int size)
    Initialize a new model.

  • Constructor Details

    • CivModel

      public CivModel​(int playerCount, int map, int size)
      Initialize a new model.
      Parameters:
      playerCount - indicates how many players this game will have

    • CivModel

      public CivModel() throws java.lang.NullPointerException
      CivModel is another constructor that will be called if the user wants to load a previous game state CivModel() unserializes a previously existing game state and sets appropriate attributes of all relevant classes.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if the file save_game.dat does not exist/ can't be opened

  • Method Details

    • getTileAt

      public Tile getTileAt​(int x, int y)
      getter method for the tile held at row, col in our Board
      Parameters:
      row - integer representing the outer index into our 2D array board
      col - integer representing the inner index into our 2D array board
      Returns:
      Tile object contained at row, col loc in our board

    • getCivBoard

      public CivBoard getCivBoard()
      for JUnit testing

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      getter method for the size of the board for move validity checking
      Returns:
      integer specifying the height and width of our board

    • changeAndNotify

      public void changeAndNotify()
      Set the state of the model to changed and notify Observers that the model has been updated. Pass the current game state (board) to all Observers.

    • getCurPlayer

      public Player getCurPlayer()
      getter for Model's current player
      Returns:
      Player object whose turn it is

    • nextPlayer

      public void nextPlayer()
      void function allowing turn logic control. Sets cur player to next player.

    • isComputer

      public boolean isComputer()
      Allows the controller to know whether to execute Player Turn logic or Computer Turn logic.
      Returns:
      If CurPlayer isComputer

    • roundNumber

      public int roundNumber()
      Keep track of which round it is by counting how many times we go through all the players Allows the model to know when to level-up cities and more.
      Returns:
      an int specifying how many times we have made it through all of the players

    • removePlayer

      public boolean removePlayer​(Player deadGuy)
      Remove a player who has no more cities left from the game
      Parameters:
      deadGuy - The player whose city was just killed
      Returns:
      true if it worked, false if it didn't

    • numPlayers

      public int numPlayers()
      Provides controller access to however many players are in the game
      Returns:
      an int of the number of players in the game

    • getAllPlayers

      public java.util.List<Player> getAllPlayers()
      Get a list of all players in the model.
      Returns:
      A flat list of all this model's Player objects

    • isSinglePlayer

      public boolean isSinglePlayer()
      Determine whether this is a single-player game (one with a human vs a CPU player).
      Returns:
      True if this is a single-player game, false otherwise

    • initPlayerStartingCoords

      private java.lang.String initPlayerStartingCoords​(int map, int size)
      Initialize player starting coordinates based on map and number of players
      Parameters:
      map - int specifying which map the user has selected (1-4)
      size - int specifying the size of the map (only applicable if map 4)
      Returns:
      a String that will be the location of the map to open, unless map == 4

    • getPlayerStartingCoords

      public java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getPlayerStartingCoords()
      Provide access to the list of starting coordinates for the controller to place starting units
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of length-2 int arrays, each containing a starting coordinate

    • getHead

      public Player getHead()
      returns "Player 1" Player object for controller
      Returns:
      "Player 1" object

    • done

      public boolean done()
      Controller calls done in its close() method. done() saves the whole game state by writing it to an ObjectOutputStream.
      Returns:
      true if the save was successful, false if it failed.
